text: hi there mark here with Walter's world
and we're in Vienna Austria one of the
many countries I've lived in but
unfortunately one of the country I
actually lived in without a host family
and today what we have for you are the
five things you're going to love and
hate about living with a host family
because some of the things are so great
the connections you make and the
families you join but also things you're
going to hate like the rules and all the
fun that goes along with having another
mom telling you what to wear okay
so let's get started and of course you
know I like to get the bad news out of
the way first so let's just get started
the first thing you're not going to like
about living with a host family a new
set of rules okay it took you what 20
years or 15 years to figure out how your
mom works how your dad works
what rules you can bend what rules you
can break and now you've got a whole new
set of rules that come from your new
host family and they might have their
own rules or the organization you're
traveling with might have rules or your
university or if you're doing a study
abroad program as an adult there's
certain things you have to follow and
that's one of the really tough things is
getting used to it you know like when I
lived in Finland my in the US my parents
let me stay out as late as I wanted when
I moved to Finland they wanted me home
at like 11 o'clock ten o'clock at night
on the weekends which kind of put a
hamper on my social life so you do have
these new rules and that can lead to a
lot of frustration with your host family
so one of the things I recommend you do
is you have a first night questionnaire
you go through when do we have breakfast
when do we have lunch dinner you know
what are the rules about going out can I
have friends spend the night what if I
want to go out of town what what are my
chores I need to get done and get that
out of the way first so everybody is on
the same page because what happens is
you may think you can stay out till 2:00
in the morning and they think it's 12
and then finally when it comes to ahead
they're mad at you you're mad at them
and you don't really get to the issue so
make sure you go through those first
night questionnaires first to eliminate
a lot of the issues with these new rules
so you least get them down and you know
what you can and can't do it sucks but
hey that's one thing you got to deal
with and that's the first thing you're

going to have the second thing you might
not like about living abroad which can
be a good and a bad is the simple

they're going to have other kids they're

this can be a good thing because they

on the other side if you're a popular

there the third thing you won't like
about living with the host family is
most of the time they don't know much

differences that you have and they have
they won't know about and that can cause
some friction you know for example when
I lived in in Finland
you know we they had big lunches and our

abroad you have your breakfast you have
your lunch
you have your afternoon snack like you
do in Portugal then you eat your
American meal at 6:00
well Portuguese don't eat dinner until

I'm just saying it's good to let them

having a host family it's like big

another mom looking over you are you
going to wear that out tonight who are

I came to study abroad to be independent
and I've lived with families when I was
in my 20s and my teens and it's still
where are you going what are you doing
when are you coming home like oh my god
I'm an adult now you can trust me so
having that big brother over tap you can

the course already paid them for the

really bad situation with all my host
families and I wanted to move but I

for them to find another family so if

make sure you track all that let your

look here are the issues here's what

but realize you may be out of some cash

another apartment or something like that

it's like when I was in China and I went

and they teach us the hola soy Marc como

Portuguese just by then fortunate down

really help with learning the language
which of course it helps you integrate
and make new friends when you're going
abroad understand the culture understand
the TV and get better grades in your

which I think is really important is if

chocolate-chip cookies
not just Chips Ahoy you buy at the store

all
really and he had my glasses on when I'd
